page.title: 04FARMING
page.content:
Goodwood farm totals 1,214 hectares (3,000 acres) and rises from the gravel soils of the Chichester Plain to the chalk downs, of which the racecourse, with its new grandstand is a prominent feature.
The farm is mainly arable, but also has a dairy herd and a flock of sheep. Crops grown are as follows:-
Winter Wheat - 330 hectares Spring Barley - 145.6 hectares Oil Seed Rape - 185.5 hectares Winter Beans - 44.9 hectares Peas - 43.0 hectares 1 year leys - 40.7 hectares 2 year leys - 60.4 hectares Permanent Pasture - 191.4 hectares Downland - remaining land.
